io.sphere.sdk.products

Interface Product

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CreationTimestamped, Identifiable<Product>, Referenceable<Product>, Resource<Product>, ResourceIdentifiable<Product>, ResourceView<Product,Product>, Timestamped, Versioned<Product>

    public interface Product
extends Resource<Product>

    A sellable good.

    Consider to use ProductProjection for queries if you don't need the whole product data so you can safe traffic and memory.

    See Also:
    ProductCreateCommand, ProductUpdateCommand, ProductDeleteCommand, ProductQuery, ProductByIdGet, ProductProjection, Category, ProductType, ProductDiscount, ProductDiscount.getReferences(), DiscountedPrice, Review.getTarget()

      • referenceOfId

        static Reference<Product> referenceOfId(String id)
        Creates a reference for one item of this class by a known ID.

        An example for categories but this applies for other resources, too:

        final String categoryIdFromFormOrSession = "84ac4271-0fec-49d0-9fee-55586c565c58";
final Reference<Category> categoryReference = Category.referenceOfId(categoryIdFromFormOrSession);
assertThat(categoryReference.getId()).isEqualTo(categoryIdFromFormOrSession);

        See the test code.

        If you already have a resource object, then use toReference() instead:

        final Category category = getCategory();
final Reference<Category> categoryReference = category.toReference();
assertThat(category.getId()).isEqualTo(categoryReference.getId());

        See the test code.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the resource which should be referenced.
        Returns:
        reference
